input: user: Draft a song of farewell sung by a bard.
coverage:
(Verse 1)  
Hark, gentle folk, to this my doleful lay,  
'Tis time for farewells, and this heart must say:  
"Adieu, fair compeers, companions dear and true,  
The sun doth sink, the stars arise anew."  
Thou whom the fates hath kindly placed,  
Within this humble grasp embraced.  
With heavy heart, I bid thee go,  
Anon to lands where rivers flow.  

(Chorus)  
Farewell, farewell, 'tis time to part,  
Though distance claims thee, yet near my heart.  
O'er hill and dale our souls shall meet,  
In dreams where'er the oceans beat.  

(Verse 2)  
The dawn of morrow shall greeting send,  
A voyage embarked, thy path to wend.  
May fortune's wind upon thee blow,  
And fair horizons greet thine eye's glow.  
When moon doth silver thine evening's rest,  
Think on the kinsmen thou hast blessed.  
Though ye depart, remember thisâ€”  
Our friendship's touch, eternal as bliss.  

(Chorus)  
Farewell, farewell, 'tis time to part,  
Though distance claims thee, yet near my heart.  
O'er hill and dale our souls shall meet,  
In dreams where'er the oceans beat.  

(Bridge)  
Thus take thou wings, on zephyrs ride,  
Our paths henceforth in stars abide.  
The morn may weep for yonder friend,  
Yet in its rise, our spirits mend.  

(Outro)  
So bear this song within thy soul,  
As gentle balm, to make thee whole.  
Remember me, this bard's refrain,  
Till our hearts entwine again. 

Fare thee well, dear friend, thou art cherished still,  
In memory's keep, and heart's gentle will.
